DOC.brief_summary: The aim of study is to describe the clinical, immunological, serological, virological and therapeutic characteristics of HIV+ patients harboring isolated anti-HBc profile and to assess the response to vaccination in these patients.
DOC.brief_title: Isolated Anti-HBc Serological Profile in HIV Infected Patients: Immunological, Virological Characteristics and Response to Hepatitis B Vaccination
DOC.criteria: HIV+ adults patients negative HBsAg negative aHBs Ab positive HBc Ab without HBV vaccination CD4 cell above 200 /mm3 HIV viral load below 50 copies/mL positive HBs antigenemia in the past transaminitis above fivefold upper normal limit PT<50% or Platelet <50 000/mm3 ongoing opportunistic infection ongoing or recent systemic corticoid or immunomodulatory therapy, splenectomy, pregnancy, contraindication to intramuscular injection, familial history of neurological disease.
